metadata.description: Project Database helpers - Core project table operations (project metadata: name, purpose, goals, status, version, blueprint tracking)
metadata.notes: Project table is singular (one entry per database). These helpers manage the main project metadata distinct from infrastructure/files/tasks.

fields.name: Function name
fields.database: Which database this helper operates on
fields.purpose: Detailed description of what this helper does
fields.parameters: Array of parameter objects with name and type
fields.return_statements: Array of AI behavioral guidance - what to check/do next after calling this helper
fields.used_by_directives: Array of directive names that use this helper
fields.is_tool: Boolean - exposed via MCP as tool
fields.is_sub_helper: Boolean - internal utility helper not directly called by AI/directives
fields.calls_helpers: Array of helper names this function calls

helpers.name: create_project
helpers.purpose: Create new project entry in project table. Only one project per database.
return_statements: Returns project_id (should always be 1)
last_known_git_hash and last_git_sync fields populated automatically
Only one project entry allowed per database
Use this during project initialization
After creating project, typically create completion path stages
helpers.error_handling: Returns error if project already exists (only one project per database).

helpers.name: get_project
helpers.purpose: Get the project entry. Returns entire project record since there's only one entry.
return_statements: Returns single project record or None if no project exists
No need for special getters since there's only one entry
Returns complete project metadata including git sync status
Check user_directives_status to determine if user directives are active
helpers.error_handling: Returns None if no project entry exists.

helpers.name: update_project
helpers.purpose: Update project metadata. All parameters are optional (null = don't update).
return_statements: At least one parameter must be provided
Updated_at timestamp set automatically by trigger
Version changes should be accompanied by notes explaining evolution
Status changes (e.g., to 'completed') should be validated against completion path
helpers.error_handling: Returns error if no update values provided or project doesn't exist.

helpers.name: blueprint_has_changed
helpers.purpose: Check if ProjectBlueprint.md has changed by comparing checksum against stored value.
return_statements: Returns true if blueprint checksum differs from stored value
Returns false if blueprint unchanged
Creates checksum of ProjectBlueprint.md file
Compares against project.blueprint_checksum field
If true, consider updating project version and running project_evolution
helpers.error_handling: Returns false if ProjectBlueprint.md doesn't exist or project entry missing.

helpers.name: project_update_git_status
helpers.purpose: Update project's last_known_git_hash and last_git_sync fields with current Git HEAD.
return_statements: No parameters needed - gets git data automatically
Updates last_known_git_hash from current Git HEAD
Updates last_git_sync to current timestamp
Called after commits and during session initialization
Enables external change detection via git_detect_external_changes
helpers.error_handling: Gracefully handles Git unavailability - logs warning but continues.
